page.title: 08THE PRIORY OF OUR LADY(cont)
page.content: After the move to Sayers Common in 1978, the purpose of the community was changed from education to hospitality, providing peace and quiet for groups of men, women and school children, for study and contemplation. There 36 nuns aged from 20 to 93 years. First they become Postulents, then Novices before taking final vows after at least 8 years. They are allowed to visit their families, and to go shopping. They attend services throughout the day beginning at 0545, but on Sunday they start at 0645. the eldest nun is 93 and she has been in the order 65 years There are 36 bedrooms and 20 guest rooms, fruit trees, vegetable garden, herb garden and a gravelled drive.The meadows are rented out for grazing. Over the old stables, there is a weather vane shaped like a pig. There were 600 pigs on the original farm.
